law.catch_line: An affidavit of support may be executed in the manner provided under this section if:...

section.section: The Administration shall set the amount of the support obligation in accordance with the guidelines.
Unless the Administration determines that application of the guidelines would be unjust or inappropriate in a particular case, the amount specified in the guidelines shall apply.
In determining whether application of the guidelines is unjust or inappropriate, the Administration may consider the factors stated in § 12-202 of this article.

If the Administration finds that application of the guidelines is unjust or inappropriate in a particular case, the Administration shall make a written finding on the record stating the reasons for departing from the guidelines.

text.section: An affidavit of support shall be completed on a standardized form developed by the Administration.

section.section: Before completing an affidavit of support form, the parties shall be advised orally and in writing of the legal consequences of executing the affidavit and of the right to seek legal counsel.
The Administration shall provide each party with a copy of the executed affidavit of support.

text.section:
An executed affidavit of support constitutes a legal finding of a support obligation, subject to the right of any party to:
rescind the affidavit in writing to the Administration within 60 days after execution of the affidavit; or
challenge the affidavit of support in court on the basis of fraud, duress, or material mistake of fact or that the affidavit of support is not in accordance with the child support guidelines.

Within 30 days after expiration of the 60-day recission period specified in subsection (d)(1) of this section, the Administration shall file an affidavit of support with the clerk of a circuit court for approval by the court.
